title: panic: ethash_full_new IO or memory error
body:
On a Raspberry Pi 2 with 4GB Swap.
 after running miner.start(1) I receive panic: ethash_full_new IO or memory error

using go-ethereum latest built with go1.5.2 linux/arm

Using the RPI because I need the GPIO pins for prototyping

```
**pi@ethernode:~/workspace/tmp/eth $ geth --datadir 60/01 --port 30601 --rpcport 8601 --maxpeers 0 --nodiscover --mine --networkid 456123789 console 2> 60/01.log **

instance: Geth/v1.3.2-54904379/linux/go1.5.2
 datadir: 60/01
coinbase: 0xb2777bf0fe432db9b933d54d6ed71c065e17c330
at block: 0 (Wed, 31 Dec 1969 18:00:00 CST)
modules: admin:1.0 db:1.0 debug:1.0 eth:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 shh:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0
> miner.start(1)
true
```

Hi, this is  duplicate of https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/1572 . Unfortunately generating the DAG requires quite a significant amount of memory. 4GB doesn't cut it AFAIK. Still, wondering why you would generate the DAG on an rpi? On the main network it would be pretty much useless, maybe on your own private network, but for that there's the testnet which could be an easier solution.

I was creating a private network and I needed the GPIO pins to interface with sensor inputs.  Definitely a one-off and I didn't mean to hi-jack too much of your time because of it.  Thank you for the response.

I had seen #1572 but it looked as though the issue was due to it generating two DAG's.  If increasing my swap file to something larger than 4GB would fix this, I may try to resume my work.  

This is purely for leveraging the mobility and GPIO pins of the Pi over a larger machine and interfacing through FTDI.
I have 16Gb on my computer and it still crashes..
@chabgood Please open a new issue with the crash dump. The entire ethash code was replaced a few months ago in Geth 1.6.0, so anything in this thread is moot at this point.
Sorry, the 64 bit version did fix the issue.
